[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [Touch](./blockly.touch_namespace.md)

## Touch namespace

## Functions

<table><thead><tr><th>

Function


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[checkTouchIdentifier(e)](./blockly.touch_namespace.checktouchidentifier_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Check whether the pointer identifier on the event matches the current saved identifier. If the current identifier was unset, save the identifier from the event. This starts a drag/gesture, during which pointer events with other identifiers will be silently ignored.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[clearTouchIdentifier()](./blockly.touch_namespace.cleartouchidentifier_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Clear the touch identifier that tracks which touch stream to pay attention to. This ends the current drag/gesture and allows other pointers to be captured.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getTouchIdentifierFromEvent(e)](./blockly.touch_namespace.gettouchidentifierfromevent_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Get the pointer identifier from the given event.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[shouldHandleEvent(e)](./blockly.touch_namespace.shouldhandleevent_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Decide whether Blockly should handle or ignore this event. Mouse and touch events require special checks because we only want to deal with one touch stream at a time. All other events should always be handled.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

## Variables

<table><thead><tr><th>

Variable


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[TOUCH\_ENABLED](./blockly.touch_namespace.touch_enabled_variable.md)


</td><td>

Whether touch is enabled in the browser. Copied from Closure's goog.events.BrowserFeature.TOUCH\_ENABLED


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[TOUCH\_MAP](./blockly.touch_namespace.touch_map_variable.md)


</td><td>

The TOUCH\_MAP lookup dictionary specifies additional touch events to fire, in conjunction with mouse events.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
